Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that asynchronously fetches weather data from a remote API using HTTP URL connection and processes the JSON response to extract sunrise and sunset times.

Class Description: HttpWeatherClient is an Android utility class that performs asynchronous HTTP requests to fetch weather data and parse the JSON response. It uses AsyncTask to handle network operations off the main thread.

Attributes: None (All variables are local to methods)

Methods:
1: WeatherAsyncTask(String... params) -> String - AsyncTask subclass that handles the background HTTP request. Takes URL string as input and returns null (results are processed via progress updates).
2: onProgressUpdate(String... progress) -> void - Processes the JSON response to extract sunrise and sunset times from the astronomy data.
3: convertStreamToString(InputStream inputStream) -> String - Helper method that converts an InputStream to a String for JSON parsing. Takes InputStream as input and returns the converted String.

Note: All methods include basic exception handling with empty catch blocks as shown in the reference code. The class is designed for Android platform (uses android.os.AsyncTask).

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests asynchronously to fetch and process JSON data from a given URL.

Class Description: HttpRequestHandler is a utility class that contains nested classes and methods for performing asynchronous HTTP requests and processing JSON responses. The main functionality is implemented through an AsyncTask subclass to avoid blocking the main thread during network operations.

Attributes: 
(None - This is a utility class with no instance attributes)

Methods:

Method1: MyAsyncTaskgetNews(String... params) -> String - A nested AsyncTask class that performs HTTP GET requests in the background. It takes a URL as input, establishes a connection, retrieves data, and processes the response.

Method2: onProgressUpdate(String... progress) -> void - A callback method that processes the received JSON data during the task's execution. It parses the JSON array and extracts individual JSON objects.

Method3: onPostExecute(String result2) -> void - A callback method that handles post-execution tasks after the background operation completes.

Method4: ConvertInputToStringNoChange(InputStream inputStream) -> String - A helper method that converts an InputStream into a String by reading all lines from the input stream and concatenating them.

Task Description: Create a utility class for handling various HTTP operations including GET, POST requests, file downloads, and form submissions.

Class Description: WebUtils is a utility class that provides static methods for performing common HTTP operations. It handles connection management, request configuration, and response processing.

Methods:

Method1: getBody(String reqURL) -> String - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and returns the response body as a string.
Method2: getJson(String reqURL) -> JsonNode - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and parses the JSON response into a JsonNode object.
Method3: downloadFile(String reqURL, String fileLocation) -> void - Downloads a file from the specified URL and saves it to the given file location.
Method4: post(String reqURL, String postContent) -> String - Performs a POST request with plain text content to the specified URL and returns the response body.
Method5: postForm(String reqURL, Map<String, String> fields) -> String - Performs a form submission (application/x-www-form-urlencoded) to the specified URL with the given form fields and returns the response body.
Method6: getLineStream(String reqURL) -> Stream<String> - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and returns the response as a stream of lines.
Method7: getUserAgent() -> String - Returns a formatted User-Agent string for HTTP requests.
Method8: connectionToString(HttpURLConnection con) -> String - Helper method that reads the response from an HttpURLConnection and converts it to a string.

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests using HttpURLConnection, supporting both GET and POST methods with configurable timeouts and headers.

Class Description: The RealRequest class provides functionality to make HTTP GET and POST requests with configurable connection settings. It handles request creation, header management, response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- sRequestURL: String - Static field storing the last requested URL
- httpConfig: HttpConfig - Configuration object for connection settings (timeouts, etc.)
- TAG: String - Constant for logging purposes (value: "SA.HttpRequest")

Methods:
- getData(String requestURL, Map<String, String> headerMap) -> RealResponse - Performs a GET request to the specified URL with optional headers
- postData(String requestURL, String body, String bodyType, Map<String, String> headerMap) -> RealResponse - Performs a POST request with request body, content type, and optional headers
- getHttpURLConnection(String requestURL, String requestMethod) -> HttpURLConnection - Creates and configures an HttpURLConnection instance
- setHeader(HttpURLConnection conn, Map<String, String> headerMap) -> void - Applies headers to the connection
- getRealResponse(HttpURLConnection conn) -> RealResponse - Processes the HTTP response into a standardized format
- getExceptionResponse(Exception e) -> RealResponse - Creates an error response from an exception
- setHttpConfig(HttpConfig httpConfig) -> RealRequest - Sets the HTTP configuration (builder pattern)

Task Description: Implement a custom HTTP data source for streaming media that handles connection management, redirects, and error handling, specifically designed for YouTube video streaming.

Class Description: YoutubeHttpDataSource is a custom HTTP data source implementation that extends BaseDataSource and implements HttpDataSource interface. It provides functionality for opening and closing HTTP connections, handling redirects, and managing input streams for media streaming.

Attributes:

allowCrossProtocolRedirects: boolean - Determines whether cross-protocol redirects (HTTP to HTTPS or vice versa) are allowed
connectTimeoutMillis: int - Connection timeout in milliseconds
readTimeoutMillis: int - Read timeout in milliseconds
requestProperties: RequestProperties - Contains HTTP request headers and properties
dataSpec: DataSpec - Contains information about the data to be read
connection: HttpURLConnection - The active HTTP connection
inputStream: InputStream - The input stream for reading data
opened: boolean - Flag indicating whether the data source is currently open

Methods:

open(DataSpec dataSpecParameter) -> long - Opens the data source for the specified DataSpec and returns the length of the data
makeConnection(DataSpec dataSpecToUse) -> HttpURLConnection - Creates and configures an HTTP connection, handling redirects
openConnection(URL url) -> HttpURLConnection - Opens a basic HTTP connection to the specified URL
handleRedirect(URL originalUrl, String location, DataSpec dataSpecToHandleRedirect) -> URL - Handles HTTP redirects and returns the new URL
close() -> void - Closes the data source and releases all resources
maybeTerminateInputStream(HttpURLConnection connection, long bytesRemaining) -> void - Helper method to terminate input streams on specific Android versions
closeConnectionQuietly() -> void - Safely closes the current connection without throwing exceptions

Task Description: Create a Java utility class for making HTTPS requests using HttpURLConnection with custom SSL socket factory configuration.

Class Description: HttpClientUtil is a utility class that provides methods for making HTTPS requests with custom SSL/TLS configuration. It handles both GET and POST methods, manages connection settings, and includes proper error handling and resource cleanup.

Attributes: (None - this is a utility class with only static methods)

Methods:

Method1: httpsRequest(String requestUrl, String method, String outputStr) -> HttpResponse - Makes an HTTPS request to the specified URL using the given HTTP method. Handles request body for POST methods and returns the server response.

Method2: httpsRequest2(String requestUrl, String method, String outputStr) -> HttpResponse - Alternative implementation that uses a different URL constructor with protocol handler, otherwise similar to httpsRequest.

Method3: createSSLSocketFactory() -> SSLSocketFactory - Private helper method that creates and configures an SSLSocketFactory with custom TrustManager for SSL/TLS connections. Throws IOException if SSL context creation fails.

Input Parameters:
- requestUrl: String - The HTTPS URL to connect to
- method: String - HTTP method (GET/POST)
- outputStr: String - Request body content (for POST requests)

Output:
- Returns HttpResponse object containing the server response
- Throws IOException for connection or SSL configuration errors

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based RPC client in Java that handles remote procedure calls, manages connections, and processes responses asynchronously.

Class Description: NettyRpcClient is a final class that implements RpcRequestTransport interface. It provides functionality for establishing TCP connections using Netty framework, sending RPC requests, and managing client-side communication with a remote server. The class handles connection pooling, request tracking, and graceful shutdown.

Attributes:
- serviceDiscovery: [ServiceDiscovery] - Handles service lookup to find the appropriate server address
- unprocessedRequests: [UnprocessedRequests] - Tracks outstanding RPC requests and their corresponding futures
- channelProvider: [ChannelProvider] - Manages and provides channels for communication
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Netty's client bootstrap configuration
- eventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Manages client-side I/O threads

Methods:
- NettyRpcClient() -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the Netty client configuration, including event loop group, bootstrap, and pipeline handlers
- doConnect(InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress) -> [Channel] - Establishes a connection to the specified remote address and returns the channel
- sendRpcRequest(RpcRequest rpcRequest) -> [Object] - Sends an RPC request to the server and returns a CompletableFuture containing the response
- getChannel(InetSocketAddress inetSocketAddress) -> [Channel] - Retrieves or creates a channel for the specified address
- close() -> [void] - Shuts down the client gracefully and releases resources

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based WebSocket client class that establishes and manages WebSocket connections, handles message sending/receiving, and provides connection status monitoring.

Class Description: NettyWebSocket is a WebSocket client implementation using Netty framework that supports both WS and WSS protocols. It implements the ITransport interface for WebSocket communication, providing connection management, message transmission, and status checking capabilities.

Attributes:
- mChannel: Channel - The active Netty channel for WebSocket communication
- mHandler: NettyWebSocketClientHandler - Custom handler for WebSocket events and messages
- mGroup: NioEventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for I/O operations
- mUri: String - The WebSocket server URI to connect to
- mOptions: WebSocketOptions - Configuration options for the WebSocket connection

Methods:
- connect(ITransportHandler transportHandler, TransportOptions options) -> void - Establishes a WebSocket connection to the specified URI. Initializes SSL context if needed, creates a handshaker, and sets up the Netty pipeline with necessary handlers.
  Input: 
    - transportHandler: ITransportHandler - Callback handler for transport events
    - options: TransportOptions - Connection-specific options
  Output: None (throws Exception on failure)

- send(byte[] payload, boolean isBinary) -> void - Sends data through the WebSocket connection as either binary or text frame.
  Input:
    - payload: byte[] - The data to send
    - isBinary: boolean - Flag indicating binary (true) or text (false) format
  Output: None

- isOpen() -> boolean - Checks if the WebSocket connection is currently active.
  Input: None
  Output: boolean - True if connection is open, false otherwise

- close() -> void - Closes the WebSocket connection gracefully and releases resources.
  Input: None
  Output: None (throws Exception on failure)

- validateURIAndGetPort(URI uri) -> int - Validates the WebSocket URI and determines the appropriate port.
  Input: uri: URI - The WebSocket URI to validate
  Output: int - The port number to use

- getSSLContext(String scheme) -> SslContext - Creates SSL context for WSS connections.
  Input: scheme: String - The URI scheme ("ws" or "wss")
  Output: SslContext - Configured SSL context or null for WS

- toByteBuf(byte[] bytes) -> ByteBuf - Converts byte array to Netty ByteBuf.
  Input: bytes: byte[] - Data to convert
  Output: ByteBuf - Netty buffer containing the data

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework for establishing non-blocking network connections to a remote server.

Class Description: The NettyTcpClient class provides functionality to create and manage TCP client connections using Netty's asynchronous event-driven network framework. It handles connection establishment, pipeline configuration, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- eventLoopGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Manages the event processing threads for the client
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - The main configuration object for the Netty client

Methods:
- NettyTcpClient(): [Constructor] -> [void] - Initializes the client with a new NioEventLoopGroup and Bootstrap instance
- configureBootstrap(): [void]() -> [void] - Configures the bootstrap with channel type and event loop group
- connect(int port, String host, Consumer<Connection> handler): [ChannelFuture](int, String, Consumer<Connection>) -> [ChannelFuture] - Establishes a connection to the specified host and port, allowing for pipeline configuration via the handler
- shutdown(): [void]() -> [void] - Shuts down the event loop group gracefully to release resources

Nested Class:
- Connection: [static class] - Represents an established connection with channel and HTTP/2 components
  Attributes:
    - channel: [Channel] - The network channel
    - context: [ChannelHandlerContext] - The handler context
    - connection: [Http2Connection] - HTTP/2 connection object
    - encoder: [Http2ConnectionEncoder] - HTTP/2 encoder
    - decoder: [Http2ConnectionDecoder] - HTTP/2 decoder
  Methods:
    - Connection(ChannelHandlerContext, Http2Connection, Http2ConnectionEncoder, Http2ConnectionDecoder): [Constructor] -> [void] - Creates a new connection instance
    - nextStreamId(): [int]() -> [int] - Gets the next available stream ID for HTTP/2 communication

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to a proxy server, handle SSL encryption if enabled, manage connection lifecycle, and support reconnection with exponential backoff.

Class Description: ProxyClientContainer is a Netty-based TCP client container that establishes and maintains a connection to a proxy server. It handles SSL encryption when configured, manages connection retries with exponential backoff, and provides channel management for proxy communication.

Attributes:
- logger: [Logger] - SLF4J logger instance for logging events
- workerGroup: [NioEventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Primary bootstrap for proxy server connections
- realServerBootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Bootstrap for real server connections
- config: [Config] - Configuration instance for client settings
- sslContext: [SSLContext] - SSL context for secure connections (nullable)
- sleepTimeMill: [long] - Current sleep duration for reconnection attempts

Methods:
- ProxyClientContainer() -> [void] - Constructor that initializes worker group, bootstraps, and configures channel pipelines
- start() -> [void] - Starts the client by initiating connection to proxy server
- createSslHandler(SSLContext sslContext) -> [ChannelHandler] - Creates SSL handler for secure connections
- connectProxyServer() -> [void] - Connects to proxy server with retry logic on failure
- stop() -> [void] - Shuts down the client gracefully
- channelInactive(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> [void] - Handles channel inactive events by triggering reconnection
- reconnectWait() -> [void] - Implements exponential backoff for reconnection attempts

Task Description: Implement a TCP client using Java Netty framework that can maintain persistent connections to multiple hosts and send messages to them.

Class Description: This class provides functionality to initialize and manage Netty TCP client connections to multiple hosts. It maintains a connection pool using maps to store active channels and their associated event loop groups.

Attributes:
- channelMap: Map<String, Channel> - Stores active channels mapped by host address
- groupMap: Map<String, NioEventLoopGroup> - Stores event loop groups mapped by host address

Methods:
- initSocketClientAndSendMessage(String host, String message) -> Channel - Initializes a new TCP client connection to the specified host if one doesn't exist, or reuses an existing connection. Sends the provided message to the host. Returns the Channel object for the connection.
  - Input Parameters:
    - host: String - The host address to connect to
    - message: String - The message to be sent to the host
  - Return Type: Channel - The Netty Channel object representing the connection

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a Netty-based HTTP client for RPC communication, capable of establishing and managing TCP connections, sending requests, and handling responses.

Class Description: NettyHttpConnectClient is a connection client implementation that uses Netty framework to establish HTTP connections with a remote server. It handles connection lifecycle, request sending, and connection validation.

Attributes:
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Manages client-side I/O threads
- channel: [Channel] - Represents the active network channel
- serializer: [Serializer] - Handles request/response serialization
- address: [String] - The server address including protocol and port
- host: [String] - The server hostname extracted from address

Methods:
- init: [init(String address, Serializer serializer, XxlRpcInvokerFactory xxlRpcInvokerFactory)] -> [void] - Initializes the client with server address, serializer and invoker factory. Creates Netty bootstrap and establishes connection.
- isValidate: [isValidate()] -> [boolean] - Checks if the current connection is active and valid.
- close: [close()] -> [void] - Closes the active connection and releases resources.
- send: [send(XxlRpcRequest xxlRpcRequest)] -> [void] - Serializes and sends an RPC request to the server through the established channel.

Task Description: Create a Java class that manages TCP client connections using Netty framework, handling connection establishment, maintenance, and graceful shutdown.

Class Description: HttpEventChannelManager is a Netty-based TCP client manager that creates and maintains connections to remote servers, provides connection metrics, and handles resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- LOG: [Logger] - Logger instance for logging debug and error messages
- connectionSuccess: [Counter] - Metric counter for successful connections
- connectionFailure: [Counter] - Metric counter for failed connections
- liveConnections: [AtomicDouble] - Gauge metric for current active connections
- nettyChannelBufferSize: [AtomicDouble] - Gauge metric for current channel buffer size
- lowWriteBufferWatermark: [int] - Low watermark for write buffer
- highWriteBufferWatermark: [int] - High watermark for write buffer
- eventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for I/O operations
- encoderEventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Optional event loop group for compression
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Netty bootstrap for client configuration
- channels: [ConcurrentMap<String, Channel>] - Map of active channels keyed by host:port

Methods:
- HttpEventChannelManager([Registry, MrePublishConfiguration]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes metrics, event loops, and bootstrap configuration
- findOrCreate([InetSocketAddress]) -> [Channel] - Finds existing or creates new channel for given address
- find([InetSocketAddress]) -> [Channel] - Finds existing channel for given address
- close([InetSocketAddress]) -> [void] - Closes channel for given address
- getHostPortString([InetSocketAddress]) -> [String] - Helper method to format address as host:port string

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to establish secure or non-secure connections to a remote server, with capabilities for graceful shutdown.

Class Description: The HttpUploadClient class provides functionality to create and manage a Netty-based TCP client that can connect to a specified host and port, with optional SSL/TLS encryption. It handles connection establishment, channel management, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
- host: [String] - The hostname or IP address of the remote server to connect to
- port: [int] - The port number of the remote server
- ssl: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether SSL/TLS encryption should be used
- sslCtx: [SslContext] - Netty's SSL context for secure connections (null if ssl is false)
- group: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for managing I/O operations
- bootstrap: [Bootstrap] - Netty bootstrap for configuring client connection parameters

Methods:
- HttpUploadClient(String host, int port, boolean ssl) -> [Constructor] - Initializes the client with connection parameters and SSL configuration if needed
- connect() -> [Channel] - Establishes a connection to the remote server and returns the communication channel
- shutdown() -> [void] - Shuts down the client gracefully and releases all resources
- main(String[] args) -> [void] - Example usage demonstrating client initialization, connection, and shutdown

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a transactional log writer for Elasticsearch, handling file operations using Java NIO's FileChannel for efficient I/O operations. The class should manage writing operations, buffer management, and resource cleanup.

Class Description: TranslogWriter is a transactional log writer that extends BaseTranslogReader and implements Closeable. It provides functionality to write operations to a log file using FileChannel, manage buffers, and handle synchronization. The class includes mechanisms for checkpointing, thread-safe operations, and resource management.

Attributes:
- channel: [FileChannel] - The main file channel for writing transaction log entries
- checkpointChannel: [FileChannel] - File channel for writing checkpoint information
- checkpointPath: [Path] - Path to the checkpoint file
- bigArrays: [BigArrays] - Helper for managing large arrays
- totalOffset: [long] - Current offset in the log file
- closed: [AtomicBoolean] - Flag indicating whether the writer is closed
- writeLock: [ReleasableLock] - Lock for thread-safe write operations
- syncLock: [Object] - Synchronization lock object
- buffer: [ReleasableBytesStreamOutput] - Buffer for holding data before writing
- globalCheckpointSupplier: [LongSupplier] - Supplier for global checkpoint information
- minTranslogGenerationSupplier: [LongSupplier] - Supplier for minimum translog generation
- persistedSequenceNumberConsumer: [LongConsumer] - Consumer for persisted sequence numbers

Methods:
- TranslogWriter([ShardId, Checkpoint, FileChannel, FileChannel, Path, Path, ByteSizeValue, LongSupplier, LongSupplier, TranslogHeader, TragicExceptionHolder, LongConsumer, BigArrays]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the translog writer with all required components
- writeAndReleaseOps([ReleasableBytesReference]) -> [void] - Writes the given bytes reference to the file and releases it
- writeToFile([ByteBuffer]) -> [void] - Helper method that writes buffer contents to the file channel
- readBytes([ByteBuffer, long]) -> [void] - Reads bytes from the specified position into the target buffer
- writeCheckpoint([FileChannel, Path, Checkpoint]) -> [void] - Static helper method to write checkpoint information
- close() -> [void] - Closes all resources and marks the writer as closed

Task Description: Implement a Netty-based JAX-RS server class that handles HTTP requests and integrates with RESTEasy framework for RESTful service deployment.

Class Description: SofaNettyJaxrsServer is a Netty-based embedded JAX-RS server implementation that provides HTTP communication capabilities and integrates with RESTEasy framework for RESTful service deployment. It supports both standard NIO and Epoll transport, SSL/TLS encryption, and customizable channel options.

Attributes:
- serverConfig: [ServerConfig] - Configuration object containing server settings
- bootstrap: [ServerBootstrap] - Netty server bootstrap instance
- hostname: [String] - Hostname to bind the server to
- port: [int] - Port number to listen on
- deployment: [ResteasyDeployment] - RESTEasy deployment configuration
- root: [String] - Root resource path
- domain: [SecurityDomain] - Security domain for authentication
- eventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event loop group for I/O operations
- eventExecutor: [EventLoopGroup] - Netty event executor for business logic
- ioWorkerCount: [int] - Number of I/O worker threads
- executorThreadCount: [int] - Number of executor threads
- sslContext: [SSLContext] - SSL context for secure connections
- maxRequestSize: [int] - Maximum allowed HTTP request size
- backlog: [int] - Connection backlog size
- channelHandlers: [List<ChannelHandler>] - Additional channel handlers
- channelOptions: [Map<ChannelOption, Object>] - Channel options
- childChannelOptions: [Map<ChannelOption, Object>] - Child channel options
- httpChannelHandlers: [List<ChannelHandler>] - Additional HTTP channel handlers

Methods:
- start(): [void] - Starts the Netty server and binds it to the configured host and port
- stop(): [void] - Stops the server and releases all resources
- createChannelInitializer(): [ChannelInitializer<SocketChannel>] - Creates a channel initializer for new connections
- setupHandlers(SocketChannel ch, RequestDispatcher dispatcher): [void] - Sets up the channel pipeline with required handlers
- createRequestDispatcher(): [RequestDispatcher] - Creates a RESTEasy request dispatcher

Task Description: Implement a Java class that processes large files efficiently using memory-mapped file operations (FileChannel and MappedByteBuffer) to calculate statistics (min, max, sum, count) for numeric values associated with named fields in the file.

Class Description: FileChannelProcessor is a utility class that processes large files in chunks using memory-mapped buffers, calculating statistics for named numeric values in a thread-safe manner using concurrent data structures.

Attributes:
- mins: ConcurrentHashMap<ByteBuffer, Integer> - Stores minimum values for each named field
- maxs: ConcurrentHashMap<ByteBuffer, Integer> - Stores maximum values for each named field
- sums: ConcurrentHashMap<ByteBuffer, Integer> - Stores sum of values for each named field
- counts: ConcurrentHashMap<ByteBuffer, Integer> - Stores count of values for each named field

Methods:
- processChunk(MappedByteBuffer chunk, long chunkSize) -> void - Processes a memory-mapped file chunk to calculate statistics for named numeric values
  - Input Parameters:
    - chunk: MappedByteBuffer - Memory-mapped buffer containing file data
    - chunkSize: long - Size of the chunk to process
- processFile(Path filePath) -> void - Processes the entire file by dividing it into chunks and calculating statistics
  - Input Parameters:
    - filePath: Path - Path to the file to be processed
  - Throws: IOException - If there are file I/O errors

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework to handle incoming client connections and process protocol messages.

Class Description: ProtocolServer is a Netty-based TCP server implementation that listens on a specified port, handles incoming connections, and processes protocol messages using custom channel handlers. It manages server resources including event loop groups and provides graceful shutdown capabilities.

Attributes:
- acceptorEventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Handles accepting new connections (boss group)
- networkEventLoopGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - Handles network I/O operations (worker group)
- eventExecutorGroup: [EventExecutorGroup] - Executes business logic handlers
- config: [Config] - Server configuration including port number
- applicationContext: [ApplicationContext] - Spring application context for dependency injection

Methods:
- ProtocolServer([Config] config, [ApplicationContext] applicationContext) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes event loop groups with specified configurations
- start() -> [ChannelFuture] - Starts the server, binds to the configured port, and returns a ChannelFuture that can be used to wait for server shutdown

Task Description: Implement a class that provides anonymous memory allocation capabilities using memory-mapped files, with a fallback to direct byte buffers if memory-mapped files cannot be unlinked.

Class Description: The `AnonAllocator` class is designed to allocate anonymous memory blocks that are not backed by visible files in the filesystem. It attempts to use memory-mapped files that are immediately unlinked (deleted) from the filesystem while remaining accessible through the mapping. If this technique is not supported by the system, it falls back to using direct byte buffers.

Attributes:
- MAP_AND_UNLINK_SUPPORTED: boolean - A static final flag indicating whether the system supports memory mapping with immediate file unlinking. This is determined during class initialization by testing the capability.

Methods:
- allocate(int size) -> ByteBuffer - Allocates an anonymous memory block of the specified size. If memory-mapped files with unlinking are supported, it creates a temporary file, maps it into memory, and immediately deletes the file. Otherwise, it falls back to a direct byte buffer allocation. The method returns the allocated ByteBuffer.
  - Input: size (int) - The size of the memory block to allocate in bytes.
  - Output: ByteBuffer - The allocated memory block, either as a memory-mapped buffer or a direct byte buffer.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an HTTP test server using Netty framework to handle incoming HTTP requests, process them with a custom handler, and return appropriate responses.

Class Description: HttpTestServer is a Netty-based HTTP server designed for testing purposes. It handles incoming HTTP requests, processes them using a customizable request handler, and returns JSON responses. The server can be configured to simulate failures and include custom headers in responses.

Attributes:
- port: int - The port number on which the server will listen
- fail: boolean - Flag to determine if server should respond with failure status
- requestHandler: BiConsumer<HttpRequest, JsonGenerator> - Custom handler for processing requests and generating JSON responses
- headers: Map<String, String> - Optional custom headers to include in responses
- channel: Channel - Netty channel for server communication
- group: NioEventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations
- responses: List<String> - Stores all generated responses for testing purposes
- JSON_FACTORY: JsonFactory - Static Jackson JSON factory for JSON processing

Methods:
- HttpTestServer(int port, boolean fail, BiConsumer<HttpRequest, JsonGenerator> requestHandler, Map<String, String> headers) - Constructor with all parameters
- HttpTestServer(int port, boolean fail, BiConsumer<HttpRequest, JsonGenerator> requestHandler) - Constructor without headers parameter
- run() -> void - Starts the server and binds it to the specified port
- boundPort() -> int - Returns the actual port the server is bound to
- shutDown() -> void - Gracefully shuts down the server and releases resources
- HttpTestServerHandler (inner class) - Handles incoming HTTP requests and generates responses

Task Description: Create a Java abstract class that handles file transfer operations using FileChannel for reading files and DataStreamOutput for writing data, with support for synchronization points during transfer.

Class Description: TransferType is an abstract class that provides a framework for transferring file data in chunks using NIO FileChannel for reading and a DataStreamOutput for writing. It manages buffer sizes, synchronization points, and tracks transfer progress.

Attributes:
- path: String - The file path to be transferred
- file: File - The File object representing the file to transfer
- fileSize: long - The total size of the file in bytes
- bufferSize: int - The size of the transfer buffer in bytes
- syncSize: long - The interval size at which to perform synchronization
- syncPosition: long - The current position for synchronization tracking

Methods:
- TransferType(String path, DataStream cli) - Constructor - Initializes the transfer with file path and configuration from DataStream client
- getFile() -> File - Returns the File object being transferred
- getBufferSize() -> int - Returns the buffer size for transfers
- getPacketSize(long offset) -> long - Calculates the next packet size based on current offset
- isSync(long position) -> boolean - Determines if current position requires synchronization
- transfer(FileStoreClient client, RoutingTable routingTable) -> List<CompletableFuture<DataStreamReply>> - Performs the complete file transfer operation
- write(FileChannel in, DataStreamOutput out, long offset, List<CompletableFuture<DataStreamReply>> futures) -> long - Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses for writing data
- toString() -> String - Returns a string representation of the transfer object

Task Description: Create a Java class for writing FLV (Flash Video) files using Java NIO's FileChannel and ByteBuffer for efficient file operations. The class should handle both new file creation and appending to existing files, including metadata management.

Class Description: The FLVWriter class provides functionality to write FLV video files with proper headers, metadata tags, and media data tags. It uses Java NIO channels and buffers for efficient file operations, supporting both new file creation and appending to existing files while maintaining FLV format specifications.

Attributes:
- fileChannel: [SeekableByteChannel] - Channel for writing the final FLV output file
- dataChannel: [SeekableByteChannel] - Temporary channel for storing tags before finalization
- filePath: [String] - Path to the output FLV file
- append: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether to append to an existing file
- appendOffset: [long] - Position in existing file where new data should be appended
- meta: [Map<String, ?>] - Metadata extracted from existing FLV file when appending

Methods:
- FLVWriter(String filePath) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the writer with a file path for new file creation

The class should handle connection timeouts, buffer management (including compaction), and proper resource cleanup when stopping. It should integrate with a parent HA connection service for state management and notification.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements an HTTP client for interacting with a hub API, handling authentication, and processing various API responses to retrieve encryption keys.

Task Description: Implement a Java class that establishes and manages a non-blocking TCP client connection to a Redis server using Java NIO (New I/O) techniques. The class should handle connection establishment, data writing, reading, and resource cleanup.

Class Description: PassiveRedisIndexer is a TCP client that connects to a Redis server using non-blocking I/O operations. It manages connection state, handles write operations through a queue, and reads server responses while efficiently managing system resources.

  - Output: InetAddress - The server address to connect to

SocketHandler Inner Class:
- chan: SocketChannel - The NIO channel for the TCP connection
- awaitingWriteNotification: boolean - Flag indicating if write operations are pending
- toWrite: ByteBuffer - Current buffer being written to the channel
- oblivion: ByteBuffer - Buffer for reading server responses (discarded in this implementation)

  - Input: None
  - Output: None

  - Input: None

  - Output: None

  - Output: None

Task Description: Implement a Java class for a High Availability (HA) client that manages communication with a master server using non-blocking I/O (NIO) techniques. The client should handle connection management, data reporting, and read event processing.

Class Description: DefaultHAClient is a service thread that maintains a connection to a master server for high availability purposes. It uses Java NIO's SocketChannel and Selector for non-blocking communication, manages buffer operations for data transfer, and handles connection lifecycle events.

Task Description: Implement a Java class that facilitates TCP-based communication using Java NIO (Non-blocking I/O) techniques, supporting both client and server modes with configurable options.

Class Description: NioTransport is a class that provides TCP communication capabilities using Java NIO. It can operate in either server or client mode, supports direct buffers for performance optimization, and includes methods for starting/stopping communication, sending data, and receiving data through a callback mechanism.

Task Description: Implement a Java class that manages TCP client connections using Java NIO (Non-blocking I/O) techniques, including connection establishment, data writing, and cleanup operations.

Class Description: ConnectionWorker is a Runnable class that handles asynchronous TCP client connections using Java NIO. It manages connection tasks through a selector pattern, processes write operations, and performs periodic cleanup of stale connections. The class supports concurrent operations through queue-based task management.

- myTimeService: TimeService - Provides time-related functionality
- lastCleanupTime: long - Timestamp of last cleanup operation
- mySelectorTimeoutMillis: int - Timeout for selector operations
- myCleanupTimeoutMillis: long - Timeout between cleanup operations
- myCleanupProcessor: CleanupProcessor - Handles connection cleanup
- myNewConnectionAllower: NewConnectionAllower - Controls new connection allowance

- processWriteTasks(): void - Processes pending write operations (implied from code context)
- cleanup(): void - Performs cleanup operations (implied from code context)

Task Description: Implement a TCP server using Apache MINA framework in Java that handles incoming connections, processes messages, and manages server lifecycle operations.

Task Description: Implement a Java NIO-based TCP server that handles multiple client connections asynchronously, processes incoming data, and sends responses back to clients.

Task Description: Implement a Unix domain socket-based IPC server using Java NIO that can listen for incoming messages and send responses asynchronously.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a non-blocking TCP server using Java NIO (New I/O) to handle multiple client connections efficiently. The server should accept incoming connections, assign them to processors in a round-robin fashion, and manage connection lifecycle.

Class Description: NIOAcceptor is a thread-based TCP server that uses Java NIO's Selector pattern to handle multiple client connections asynchronously. It creates a ServerSocketChannel, binds it to a specified port, and processes incoming connections by distributing them among available NIOProcessor instances.

acceptCount: [long] - Counter for accepted connections

run: [run()] -> [void] - Main thread loop that continuously checks for incoming connections using the selector
accept: [accept()] -> [void] - Accepts a new client connection, configures it as non-blocking, and assigns it to a processor
nextProcessor: [nextProcessor()] -> [NIOProcessor] - Returns the next available processor in round-robin fashion
closeChannel: [closeChannel(SocketChannel)] -> [void] - Closes the specified socket channel safely

Nested Class:
AcceptIdGenerator: [static class] - Generates unique IDs for accepted connections with thread-safe increment operation
  - acceptId: [long] - Current ID value
  - lock: [Object] - Synchronization object
  - getId: [getId()] -> [long] - Returns and increments the connection ID safely

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a multicast sender using UDP with Java NIO's DatagramChannel for non-blocking communication. The class should support both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols and allow sending messages to a multicast group.

Task Description: Implement a TCP proxy server using Vert.x that forwards incoming connections to a remote server after writing a custom header.

Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Vert.x framework to handle multiple client connections, process incoming data, and manage server lifecycle operations.

Method10: parseJSONArray(HttpURLConnection connection) -> JSONArray - Parses the response as a JSON array.

Method11: parseJSONArrayAndDisconnect(HttpURLConnection connection) -> JSONArray - Parses the response as a JSON array and disconnects the connection.

Task Description: Implement a Java class for SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) security checks that validates URLs to prevent internal network access.

Class Description: The SSRFChecker class provides functionality to check if a given URL is safe by verifying it doesn't resolve to internal IP addresses. It includes methods for URL validation, host extraction, IP resolution, and internal IP detection.

Attributes:
- logger: Logger - Used for logging error and info messages
- decimalIp: String - Stores converted IP address in decimal format

Methods:
- checkSSRF(String url, int checkTimes) -> boolean - Main method to validate URL against SSRF risks. Follows redirects up to checkTimes. Returns true if safe, false if dangerous.
- isInternalIpByUrl(String url) -> boolean - Checks if URL's host resolves to an internal IP. Returns true if internal/dangerous.
- isInternalIp(String strIP) -> boolean - Verifies if given IP is in blocked subnets. Returns true if IP is internal.
- host2ip(String host) -> String - Resolves hostname to IP address. Returns empty string on failure.
- url2host(String url) -> String - Extracts host from URL. Returns empty string for non-HTTP URLs or invalid URLs.
- isOctalIP(String host) -> boolean - (Private) Checks if host is in octal IP format. Returns true if octal format detected.

Task Description: Create a function that performs an HTTP GET request to a specified URL and returns the response as a string.

Function Description: The function should establish an HTTP connection to the provided URL, send a GET request, read the response stream, and return the content as a UTF-8 encoded string. It should handle resource cleanup properly by closing all streams and disconnecting the HTTP connection.

Input: 
- requestUrl: String - The URL to which the HTTP GET request will be sent

Output: 
- String - The response content from the HTTP GET request, or null if an error occurs

Task Description: Create a Java class that handles HTTP requests with support for proxy configuration, including making GET requests, processing responses, and handling callbacks for success and failure scenarios.

Class Description: The HttpRequestManager class manages HTTP requests with configurable proxy settings. It provides functionality to make GET requests to a specified URL, process the response (including Base64 decoding), and notify the caller of success or failure through a callback interface.

Attributes:
- mProxyOn: boolean - Indicates whether proxy is enabled
- mProxyHost: String - The host address of the proxy server
- mProxyPort: long - The port number of the proxy server

Methods:
- HttpRequestManager(boolean proxyOn, String proxyHost, long proxyPort) -> void - Constructor that initializes proxy configuration
- requestSubscribeServerConfigs(String urlStr, Callback callback) -> void - Makes a GET request to the specified URL and processes the response, notifying through callback
- readStringFromStream(InputStream inputStream) -> String - Helper method to read and convert an InputStream to a String
- interface Callback - Nested interface for handling request results
  - onSuccess(String response) -> void - Called when request succeeds
  - onFailed() -> void - Called when request fails

Task Description: Implement a lightweight HTTP client class in Java that can perform GET and POST requests with configurable headers, parameters, and timeouts.

Class Description: HttpTinyClient is a utility class that provides basic HTTP GET and POST functionality using Java's HttpURLConnection. It handles URL parameter encoding, header management, and response processing.

Attributes:
None (This is a utility class with only static methods)

Methods:

Method1: httpGet(String url, List<String> headers, List<String> paramValues, String encoding, long readTimeoutMs) -> HttpResult - Performs an HTTP GET request to the specified URL with given headers and parameters. Encodes parameters in the URL query string.

Method2: httpPost(String url, List<String> headers, List<String> paramValues, String encoding, long readTimeoutMs) -> HttpResult - Performs an HTTP POST request to the specified URL with given headers and parameters. Encodes parameters in the request body.

Method3: encodingParams(List<String> paramValues, String encoding) -> String - Helper method that encodes parameter values for URL or POST body using the specified character encoding.

Method4: setHeaders(HttpURLConnection conn, List<String> headers, String encoding) -> void - Helper method that sets request headers including default headers for content type and client version.

Nested Class: HttpResult - Represents the result of an HTTP request with status code and response content.

Attributes:
code: int - HTTP response status code
content: String - Response body content

Task Description: Create a utility class for handling HTTP POST requests with multipart form data, including both text fields and file uploads, using Java's HttpURLConnection.

Class Description: HttpPostUploadUtil is a utility class designed to simplify the process of sending HTTP POST requests with multipart/form-data content type. It handles both text parameters and file uploads, manages connection timeouts, and properly formats the multipart request body.

Attributes:
- logger: Logger - Used for logging errors and debug information
- BOUNDARY: String - A constant string used as the boundary for multipart form data (defined within the method)

Methods:
- formUpload(String urlStr, int connectTimeout, int readTimeout, Map<String, String> textMap, Map<String, MultipartFile> fileMap) -> String - Performs an HTTP POST request with multipart form data containing both text parameters and files
  Input:
    - urlStr: String - The target URL for the POST request
    - connectTimeout: int - Connection timeout in milliseconds
    - readTimeout: int - Read timeout in milliseconds
    - textMap: Map<String, String> - Key-value pairs for text form fields
    - fileMap: Map<String, MultipartFile> - Key-value pairs for file uploads (key is field name, value is file data)
  Output:
    - String - The response body from the server

- closeStream(Closeable closeable) -> void - Helper method to safely close Closeable resources
  Input:
    - closeable: Closeable - The resource to be closed
  Output: None

Task Description: Implement a Java class that provides remote service capabilities for retrieving knowledge packages from a repository server using HTTP communication.

Class Description: RemoteServiceImpl is a service class that handles HTTP communication with a remote repository server to fetch knowledge packages. It manages the connection, request/response handling, and data processing.

Attributes:
- resporityServerUrl: String - The base URL of the remote repository server
- log: Logger - Logger instance for logging information and errors

Methods:
- getKnowledge(String packageId, String timestamp) -> KnowledgePackage - Retrieves a knowledge package from the remote server using the specified package ID and timestamp
- sendRequest(String packageId, String timestamp) -> String - Internal method that handles the HTTP request/response cycle with the remote server
- setResporityServerUrl(String resporityServerUrl) -> void - Sets the repository server URL, appending the default endpoint if not present

Task Description: Create a class that handles fetching MIME types from URLs and managing download requests using Android's DownloadManager.

Class Description: The FetchUrlMimeType class is responsible for determining the MIME type of a resource at a given URL, setting up a download request with appropriate parameters, and enqueuing the download using Android's DownloadManager. It handles HTTP connections, processes response headers, and manages file naming and destination.

Attributes:
- mRequest: [DownloadManager.Request] - The download request to be configured and enqueued
- mDownloadManager: [DownloadManager] - The Android DownloadManager instance used to enqueue downloads
- mUri: [String] - The URL of the resource to be downloaded
- mCookies: [String] - Optional cookies to be included in the HTTP request
- mUserAgent: [String] - The user agent string to be used in the HTTP request

Methods:
- Constructor: [FetchUrlMimeType](DownloadManager downloadManager, DownloadManager.Request request, String uri, String cookies, String userAgent) -> [void] - Initializes the class with download manager, request, URI, cookies, and user agent
- create: [create]() -> [Single<Result>] - Creates and executes the download process, returning a Single observable with the result status. This method:
  1. Establishes an HTTP connection to the URL
  2. Extracts MIME type and content disposition from headers
  3. Configures the download request with proper MIME type and filename
  4. Enqueues the download request
  5. Returns success/failure status through the observable

Nested Enum:
- Result: [enum] - Represents possible outcomes of the download enqueue operation:
  - FAILURE_ENQUEUE: Failed to enqueue the download request
  - FAILURE_LOCATION: Failed due to storage location issues
  - SUCCESS: Download successfully enqueued
